alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 14 at 8:49AM CDT until July 18 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam affecting Washington, Clarke and Choctaw Counties. For the Tombigbee River...including Coffeeville Dam, Leroy...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River near Coffeeville Dam. * WHEN...From this evening to Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, pastureland becomes flooded. Livestock should be moved to higher ground. Old Ferry Road near the river begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 25.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 29.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 33.0 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/mob.
